ðŸ’¡ ytDownloader | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading video and audio content from various online platforms for offline access.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Supports hundreds of sites â€¢ Multiple themes â€¢ Video Compressor with Hardware Acceleration â€¢ Advanced options like Range Selection, Subtitles â€¢ Download playlists
ðŸ“– Summary: ytDownloader is a desktop application built with JavaScript that allows users to download videos and audio from various websites, including popular platforms like YouTube, Facebook, and Instagram. It offers a graphical user interface (GUI) for ease of use and supports multiple operating systems, including Linux, Windows, and macOS, with features like video compression, playlist downloading, and subtitle support.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ glide | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Efficient web browsing using keyboard navigation and extensive customization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Keyboard-based navigation â€¢ Modal keymaps â€¢ TypeScript configuration â€¢ Web extensions API support â€¢ Fuzzy tab manager
ðŸ“– Summary: Glide is an extensible and keyboard-focused web browser built on Firefox. It allows users to navigate the web efficiently using only a keyboard, offering features like modal-based keymaps, TypeScript configuration, and web extension API support. It also includes a fuzzy tab manager and site-specific settings/keymaps.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ stremio-web | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a web-based media center platform for streaming and organizing video content from various sources.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Media center functionality â€¢ Addon support for content discovery â€¢ Video content organization â€¢ Development build instructions â€¢ Production build instructions
ðŸ“– Summary: The Stremio repository hosts the web component of the Stremio media center, a platform designed for discovering, watching, and organizing video content through addons. It provides a unified interface for accessing various streaming sources.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ myDrive | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Self-hosted cloud file storage and sharing.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Upload Files â€¢ Download Files â€¢ Upload Folders â€¢ Download Folders (Automatically converts to zip) â€¢ Multiple DB Support (Amazon S3, Filesystem)
ðŸ“– Summary: MyDrive is an open-source cloud file storage server, similar to Google Drive, built with Node.js, TypeScript, and MongoDB. It allows users to host their own file storage solution, supporting features like file and folder uploads/downloads, multiple database support (Amazon S3, Filesystem), file sharing, and AES256 encryption.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ swaptop | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Monitoring swap usage on Linux and Windows systems to identify processes consuming swap and diagnose performance bottlenecks.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Real-time animated swap usage graph â€¢ Process-level swap consumption tracking â€¢ Grouped view by software (aggregate mode) â€¢ Multiple color themes â€¢ Unit conversion (KB/MB/GB)
ðŸ“– Summary: Swaptop is a real-time swap usage monitor for Linux and Windows systems with a TUI interface. It lists processes using swap, displays consumption per-process/per-software, and provides live-updating graphs, allowing users to quickly identify and address swap-related performance issues.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ github-stars-by-topic | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automatically organizing and browsing GitHub stars by topic.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Fetches GitHub stars using user credentials. â€¢ Extracts text from repository titles, descriptions, and README files. â€¢ Applies Term Frequency Inverse Document Frequency (TF-IDF) for keyword extraction. â€¢ Uses Non-Negative Matrix Factorization (NMF) for topic modeling.
ðŸ“– Summary: This Python script automatically sorts a user's GitHub stars by topic using machine learning. It fetches starred repositories, extracts relevant text from their titles, descriptions, and READMEs, and then applies TF-IDF and NMF to identify topics and categorize the stars accordingly, generating a browsable folder structure in Markdown.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ smartcut | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Cutting video files with minimal re-encoding to preserve quality and speed up the editing process.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Efficient Cutting: Only recodes around cutpoints. â€¢ Flexible Input: Supports a wide range of video/audio formats and codecs. â€¢ Flexible cutting: Allows for both 'keep' and 'cut' operations. â€¢ Audio Export: Includes all audio tracks by default with nearly lossless passthrough.
ðŸ“– Summary: The `smartcut` repository provides a command-line tool for efficiently cutting video files with minimal re-encoding. It's designed as a companion to Smart Media Cutter, offering fast video editing capabilities for various formats and codecs, focusing on precise cut points while preserving original video quality.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
